title: Gunnar (barbarian)

A stub is an article which does not cover all information available about the topic. You can help by expanding it.

Gunnar was a Fremmenik barbarian from a mountain nomadic tribe. He and his friends with families left his large tribe to find a new home.[1]

Gunnar is known to had been leading the Runecrafting Crusades around Kandarin and Asgarnia.[2] He is also responsible for the slaugthering of the Imcando dwarfs.[3] After losing significant amount of his army, he settled west of Avarrocka near the River Lum, now known as the Barbarian Village. Although initial plan was to lay low and continue attacking again soon[4], they buried their hatchet with rune-users and coexist now peacefully.[5]

Gunnar is a direct ascendent to Gunthor the brave, the current chiefstein of the Barbarian Village.[6]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Hunding, Old School RuneScape. "SIn time, a warrior called Gunnar took his friends and their families and left the larger tribe"
  2. ↑ Display case 2, Old School RuneScape. "A group of the more warmongering of the mountain tribe broke away, led by a warrior called Gunnar, and went on a rampage across northern Kandarin and Asgarnia to put a stop to this 'runecrafting'."
  3. ↑ Display case 2, Old School RuneScape. "The invading Fremennik were not happy about all the spellcasting and launched many attacks, reducing the Imcando to near extinction."
  4. ↑ Display case 1, Old School RuneScape. "The barbarian invaders were running out of steam. They were pretty much forced to make peace or be wiped out, so they agreed to settle down peacefully and make a village on the Misthalin/Asgarnia border, thinking they could lie low, well positioned to build up strength and resume their campaign later.."
  5. ↑ Hunding, Old School RuneScape. "Some of our young, wishing to try so-called 'civilisation' and the softness of city life, abandon the tribe and move to the cities. It is sad to see them go, but we do not prevent them; we live here in our village because we love this life - we do not force it on those whom it does not suit."
  6. ↑ Hunding, Old School RuneScape. "Our current chieftain, Gunthor the Brave, is a direct- line descendent of Gunnar."
